availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Steven Robnet (Pike County and Johnson County, farm laborer and soldier)

body.p: Pike County, Kentucky and Johnson County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Elizabeth Francis Robnet on August 31, 1848. Father of John Robnet, Hiram Robnet, Susan Robnet, Nancy Robnet, George W. Robnet, and Samuel H. Robnet. Farm Laborer in Pike County in 1860. Served in the 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia as corporal from May 21, 1864 to June 21, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pike County, District 1, p. 106.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pike County, District 10, p. 8.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 000839494, p. 36.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 896.
Kentucky Death Records on Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994052, Owsley, Pendleton, Perry, and Pike County Deaths p. 655.
